comments.body:
From https://metacpan.org/pod/Unix::Processors:
>DISTRIBUTION
>
>The latest version is available from CPAN and from http://www.veripool.org/.
>Copyright 1999-2017 by Wilson Snyder. This package is free software; you you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of either the GNU Lesser General Public License Version 3 or the Perl Artistic License Version 2.0.

I'm no Perl expert at all, so I have no idea whether `Perl Artistic License Version 2.0` is equivalent to `perl_5`. Can you confirm that?

My understanding was that `perl_5` means "under the same license terms as Perl 5", which is a phrase used in many Perl module distributions. Since Perl 5 is dual-licensed, the code can be used under both the GPL or the Perl Artistic license, cf. https://dev.perl.org/licenses/. Is there support for multi-licensed packages in conda? So could I add multiple licenses as a list under the `about/license` key?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +30,34 @@about:
  home: https://metacpan.org/pod/Unix::Processors
  license: perl_5
  summary: Interface to processor (CPU) information
